item.title: Haiku from SAS R&D staff
item.description: First prompts are silent. Subsequent prompts loud and clear. Now all prompts are heard. Poem from R&D staff? Yes. Rhyming sonnets were shakespeare-like complex; they wrote Japanese haiku, showed as above. The SAS R&D staff should complete some paper work in defects system before changing a code. They use informal descriptive language(HAIKUUU!) in the early stage. Chris Hemedinger, a senior software engineer at SAS, collected some haikus in his blog to show the humor side of SAS R&D staff.
